intro: Limnanthemum whytei, commonly known as the water starflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in wetland or swampy environments. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are usually submerged or floating, adapting to its aquatic habitat. Limnanthemum whytei is an herbaceous perennial, and it plays a role in providing habitat for aquatic insects and invertebrates. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in wet garden settings.
